data.text: @killmongersthot @PenguinUKBooks I’m guessing you mean Beyoncé, not me.
@PenguinUKBooks But that’s why everything is perfect, for you to learn and grow.

@SStone6 @Ittymay @PhilipArdagh @PenguinUKBooks In PR? In a publishing house? Are you kidding me? Penny to a pound they are white upper middle class  females below thirty with no kids. It’s just the way of the world. Also, can you imagine a group of blokes choosing Beyoncé as a source for a quote? Be honest please.
@jackmar10745832 @Ittymay @PhilipArdagh @PenguinUKBooks How do you know they are "girls"?

@Ittymay @PhilipArdagh @PenguinUKBooks The girls in the PR dept are clearly not down with conditionals and the use of subjunctives but they most likely have degrees in meeja studies or something equally as academic. I was so angered and disappointed by the source material, I hadn’t noticed this glaring error. Bad me!
@PhilipArdagh @PenguinUKBooks And it’s not as though she’s not down with the subjunctive! https://t.co/iPW8iAaEIk

@PenguinUKBooks "But you wouldn't need to learn and grow because, by your own statement everything - including your level of knowledge and development - would be perfect, so your statement is meaningless shite." Philip Ardagh "And, PS, you mean WERE perfect." #TuesdayThoughts

@PenguinUKBooks Beyoncé Knowles should not be used by Penguin Books as a source of wisdom. Don’t continue the race to the bottom to seem with it. You have so much material to choose from for real wisdom but it’s easier to lift it from Smash Hits than your PR dept to read an actual book. Very sad

@PenguinUKBooks In a perfect world you will always be learning & growing. A perfect world must contain you because without you it would not be perfect. You would be the perfect you because everything in a perfect world is perfect. Therefore if everything was perfect you would always grow & learn
